title: Address
description: With fascination, commitment and curiosity for nature: The Museum für Naturkunde Berlin is a research museum of the Leibniz Association.
cleaned_text: Museum für Naturkunde Startseite [22 September Get your tickets now Beats & Bones Podcast Festival](/en/museum/events/beats-bones-podcast-festival) [A work of art for insects on the forecourt of the Museum Pollinator Pathmaker](/en/science/pollinator-pathmaker-a-living-artwork-pollinators) [New insights every two weeks on YouTube Become part of our Museum Evolution](/en/future/join-our-museum-evolution) [Exhibition until end 2023 "digitize!" - we are digitalizing our collection and you can be a part of it!](/en/museum/exhibitions/digitize) Welcome to Museum für Naturkunde Berlin Our mission is to discover and describe life and earth - with people, through dialogue. We want to engage with and influence the scientific and societal discourse about the future of our planet, worldwide. Learn more about the [museum](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/museum), our [research](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/science/research), and our [plan for the future](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/future). Integrated museum is a living artwork for pollinating insects by artist Alexandra Daisy Ginsberg on the forecourt. In the project we offer guided tours and workshops on insects in the city, wild bee protection and sustainable garden design. [Annual Report 2022 Annual Report 2022](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/de/ueber-uns/das-museum/publikationen-und-downloads) The Museum für Naturkunde reviews the year 2022. The return of T. rex Tristan Otto, the new special exhibition "Dinosaurs!" as well as the campaign "Safeguarding Nature!" illustrate our ambitions to provide science-based, democratic solutions and alliances for a climate-compatible, biodiversity-friendly and equitable civilisation. [Book publication Prussian Kunstkammer](/en/press/press-releases/new-book-publication-prussian-kunstkammer) Research cooperation between the MfN, the Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin and the National Museums in Berlin publishes results of the DFG-funded project "The Window on Nature and Art. A historical-critical reappraisal of the Brandenburg-Prussian Kunstkammer". [Paleontology BROMACKER](https://bromacker.net/bromacker-en.html) The project combines paleo research and science communication at the excavation site in the UNESCO Geopark Thuringia Inselsberg - Drei Gleichen, at Schloss Friedenstein Gotha. [Knowledge transfer TheMuseumsLab](https://themuseumslab.org/) In the international cooperation "TheMuseumsLab", African and European museum staff jointly develop concepts for the future of museums in Africa and Europe. The project promotes mutual learning, exchange and training. [Paleontology PALEONILE](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/press/press-releases/sudan-and-museum-fur-naturkunde-berlin-conduct-joint-research-new-erc-project) In the large-scale systematic paleontological project, interdisciplinary research on the paleontology of the Nile Basin in Sudan is conducted together with Al Neelain University in Khartoum. This knowledge about the recent past can help solving research questions of the present and future. [Provenance Provenance research under the spotlight](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/science/provenance-research-under-spotlight) The project creates a digital Edition of the Annual Reports of the Museum 1887-1915 and 1928-1938. This can be used, for example, for the assessment of colonial objects in the collections. [Paleobotany Amber forests](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/science/amber-forests) In the project we examine plant inclusions in amber, to identify them and to draw conclusions about their ecosystems. These objects help us to understand distribution patterns and morphological evolution of plant families Participate Create new knowledge with us. [More info Data Portal](/en/science/data-portal) [More Wissenschaft im Dialog, we operate buergerschaffenwissen.de, the central online platform for citizen science in Germany. More than 130 projects from a wide range of disciplines currently invite people to participate in research. [Collection Transcription Workshop](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/museum/participate/transcription-workshop) Learn to read old German manuscripts and transfer historical documents from the archive of the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin into modern script. Only in this way historical documents can be made accessible for further research. [Citizen Science Changing Natures. Collecting the Anthropocene Together](https://www.changing-natures.org/en/) What do everyday objects and personal memories tell us about environmental change? Which personal items reflect the human impact on nature for you? "Changing Natures" is a digital, participatory collection experiment on the Anthropocene. Encounter with the other species Around 90 per cent of all species on earth are unknown. The Museum für Naturkunde Berlin is doing everything it can to discover the nameless before they become extinct - in Berlin as well as in the rainforest of Vietnam. Elisabeth Heyne: The story collector Humans are changing nature with all their power. As a result, science is recognising a new geological epoch: the Anthropocene - the age of humans. Elisabeth Heyne is building a digital collection of all kinds of everyday things at the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin that connect people with this new reality. Digital experience Experience the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin at your home. [Online exhibition Life: Through the Looking Glass](https://www.life-throughthelookingglass.com) The online exhibition showcases the research of the EvoCELL network, a Marie Skodowska-Curie Innovative Training Network (ITN) that includes 11 excellent research departments and institutions across Europe, including the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin. [Exhibition Guided Tours on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8KH6MxYBVeY&list=PLeTlYFAGADkP9eGHQzXCFTPGanrFr1T8C) In our Guided Tours, you can experience the museum and its collection from home. Accompany our guides on YouTube on a research trip through the exhibition! [Game twiddle - the museum riddle](/en/museum/bildung/twiddle-the-museum-riddle) Explore the world in eight museums! With twiddle, the new game of the eight research museums within the Leibniz Association, you can embark on a tour of discovery with our collection objects. Download now for free! [Podcast Beats & Bones](https://www.museumfuernaturkunde.berlin/en/museum/furnatur-digital/beats-bones-podcast-museum-fur-naturkunde-berlin) In the award winning Beats & Bones podcast, we open doors to our collection and research laboratories that are otherwise closed. Experts speak about everything from the realm of nature, from bees to Tyrannosaurus rex. Get in touch Children's birthday parties Plan and book your children's birthday party with our team. Guided tours Book one of our guided tours with various themes for children from age 5 onwards, for teenagers and adults. Educational offerings Choose from a variety of digital offerings, guided tours, workshops and materials for school and kindergarten groups.
